author: La rédaction avec AFP
title: Football. Les Girondins de Bordeaux renoncent à leur statut professionnel
text: Football Les Girondins de Bordeaux renoncent à leur statut professionnel Le club bordelais, relégué mardi en National, a annoncé jeudi qu'il préférait renoncer à son statut professionnel pour éviter des sanctions supplémentaires. Les jours se suivent et se ressemblent aux Girondins de Bordeaux. Le club au Scapulaire, [rétrogadé en National](/sport/2024/07/23/l2-bordeaux-renonce-a-son-appel-et-retrograde-administrativement-en-national), a renoncé jeudi au statut professionnel obtenu en 1937. Une décision aux « conséquences funestes », selon le maire de la ville [Pierre Hurmic](/p/pierre-hurmic), qui déplore notamment la fermeture du centre de formation. Dans un communiqué publié jeudi soir, le club, qui avait terminé 12e de Ligue 2 mais a été sanctionné pour ses errements financiers, indique avoir « déposé le bilan » mardi auprès du Tribunal de commerce « afin d'entamer la restructuration nécessaire », ce qui aura pour conséquence « très prochainement » « l'ouverture d'une procédure collective qui entraînera automatiquement la perte du statut professionnel du club ». La crainte de « sanctions supplémentaires » La saison de National débutant mi-août, le club a préféré « renoncer à demander le maintien de son statut professionnel faute de quoi il aurait dû se présenter à nouveau devant la DNCG (Direction nationale du contrôle de gestion) avec un budget ne correspondant pas à (s)a réalité à venir (...), ce qui aurait pu le conduire à des sanctions supplémentaires lourdes ». Cet « effort de transparence » sur « la situation réelle du club » « doit notamment permettre de limiter les conséquences sportives de cette situation », poursuivent les Girondins qui ont « pour objectif d'évoluer en National 1 la saison prochaine, pour permettre, au plus vite, le retour du Club, avec des finances assainies et une ambition renouvelée, au plus haut niveau ». Le maire de Bordeaux en colère L'équipe sextuple championne de France pouvait pourtant espérer conserver le statut professionnel, et donc son centre de formation, si elle était autorisée à repartir en National, division hybride mêlant clubs pros et amateurs. Mais sa direction, qui espère que le tribunal de commerce privilégiera le redressement judiciaire à une liquidation pure et simple, a semble-t-il préféré faire table rase des contrats en vigueur en raison des difficultés du club, qui cherchait 40 millions d'euros pour assainir ses comptes et boucler son budget 2024-2025 en Ligue 2. « J'apprends avec consternation la décision soudaine autant que personnelle de Gérard Lopez, a cinglé Pierre Hurmic dans une déclaration transmise à l'AFP. Elle confirme des choix de gestion hasardeux qui ont amené en trois saisons notre club qui évoluait dans l'élite de la L1 au niveau amateur. » La fin de 87 ans chez les professionnels « L'abandon du statut professionnel aura des conséquences funestes avec, en premier lieu, la disparition du centre de formation », ajoute le maire écologiste, qui affirme « que d'autres options étaient et seraient encore possibles pour sauver le club ». « Si la gouvernance actuelle n'a plus le ressort, les moyens, l'envie de défendre avec énergie la survie de notre club centenaire, patrimoine commun de notre territoire, alors, elle doit en tirer toutes les conséquences », conclut-il. Cet abandon de statut met un terme à 87 années d'appartenance du FC Girondins de Bordeaux au football professionnel français et liquide son très réputé centre de formation, où ont notamment été formés les internationaux français actuels [Jules Koundé](/p/jules-kounde) (FC Barcelone) et [Aurélien Tchouaméni](/p/aurelien-tchouameni) (Real Madrid). Se pose également la question de l'avenir du personnel administratif (90 salariés).

author: Persistence Market Research
title: Digital Dentistry Market Surges with 13.1% CAGR Through 2032 -
text:
Digital Dentistry Market Surges with 13.1% CAGR Through 2032 - Persistence Market Research 07-31-2025 06:14 AM CET | Health & Medicine
Press release from: Persistence Market Research Digital Dentistry Market
The global digital dentistry market is experiencing an unprecedented growth phase thanks to technological advancements and the integration of data-driven workflows. From diagnosis and treatment planning to the delivery of personalized prosthetics, digital dentistry now encompasses an array of innovative solutions that are rapidly outpacing traditional methods. Persistence Market Research notes that the market, valued at US$5.3 billion in 2023, is set for explosive growth, surging to US$16.3 billion by 2032 at a compelling CAGR of 13.1%.
✅Get a Sample Copy of Research Report (Use Corporate Mail id for Quick Response): https://www.persistencemarketresearch.com/samples/23086
✅ Overview of the Digital Dentistry Market
Digital dentistry refers to the use of digital and computer-based approaches in delivering dental care. By leveraging CAD/CAM technologies, 3D imaging, augmented reality, and big data analytics, the industry has moved far beyond conventional workflows. The sector accounted for an 11.6% share of the global dentistry market in 2023, reflecting its pivotal role in the modernization of oral healthcare.
Market growth is being propelled by rapid developments in CAD/CAM, computer-aided diagnostic systems, and digital imaging. Key accelerators include efficiency gains, enhanced patient experiences, and increasing accessibility to custom prosthetics. According to Persistence Market Research, the CAD/CAM systems segment leads the market, coveted for their ability to cut production time and costs for dental implants, crowns, and bridges.
Geographically, North America stands at the forefront of digital dentistry adoption, due to the widespread integration of digital workflows in dental practices and hospitals. This regional dominance is tied to a high rate of technology adoption, robust reimbursement models, and a significant concentration of market leaders. The U.S., in particular, boasts impressive rates of digital workflow integration, including AR and VR solutions for patient care and training.
✅ Key Highlights from the Report:
➤ The digital dentistry market is projected to expand at a CAGR of 13.1% and reach US$16.3 billion by 2032.
➤ CAD/CAM systems accounted for approximately 37% of market revenue in 2023, driven by cost and labor savings.
➤ North America holds the leading regional share, with the U.S. capturing 81% of the North American market.
➤ China leads East Asia thanks to full automation and digital procedure integration in dental care.
➤ Hospitals are the largest end users, representing 36% of the total market value due to digital recordkeeping and cloud adoption.
➤ Major players are enhancing offerings through collaborations in AI, 3D printing, and cloud-based workflows.
✅ Market Segmentation
Digital dentistry's diverse product suite includes CAD/CAM systems, 3D printers, intraoral scanners, digital radiography units, and milling machines. Among these, CAD/CAM systems dominate, providing essential support for the rapid, precise fabrication of dental restorations and prosthetics. This segment is projected to sustain double-digit growth rates as the dental industry shifts toward chairside solutions and personalized device manufacturing.
End-user segmentation is equally dynamic. Hospitals are the biggest consumers of digital dentistry technologies, benefiting from integrated software for diagnosis, clinical workflows, and electronic health records. Dental clinics and laboratories follow closely, capitalizing on the streamlined digital environment for better diagnostics, patient communication, and treatment outcomes. The merger of data accessibility and interoperability is making it easier to implement complex digital solutions across healthcare sectors.
✅Read Detailed Analysis: https://www.persistencemarketresearch.com/market-research/digital-dentistry-market.asp
✅Regional Insights
North America retains the crown in digital dentistry, led by the U.S. where the market is defined by swift adoption of advanced digital workflows, such as 3D printing and AR-assisted procedures. The American dental industry is characterized by high technology penetration, well-established private practices, and substantial investments in innovation, which collectively drive new product launches and collaborations among leading vendors.
Germany serves as a European stronghold, representing 26.5% of the regional market in 2023. The German dental sector benefits from the prevalence of independent clinics transforming analog workflows to digital models. Reimbursement frameworks and the prevalence of advanced procedural adoption increase the region's sales potential for digital dentistry products, attracting both start-ups and established providers into the market.
China is rapidly emerging as a key growth engine in East Asia. The country's digital dentistry market accounts for 35% of the regional share due to the robust adoption of automation and AI-driven workflows in dental implantology. With the landmark deployment of a fully automated dental robot for implant surgery in 2017, China solidified its position as a technological innovator, driving new levels of clinical accuracy and operational efficiency.
✅Market Drivers
Digital dentistry's meteoric rise is anchored in a technology revolution across diagnostics, manufacturing, and treatment delivery. Advances in CAD/CAM and 3D imaging are making it possible to deliver precise, customized oral prosthetics at lower costs and in record time. The field is further boosted by the proliferation of electronic health records, facilitating seamless data exchange and fostering integration across specialties. Growing consumer demand for minimally invasive procedures and quick turnaround solutions further amplifies the adoption rate.
Artificial intelligence and big data analytics are enabling smarter diagnostics, predictive care modeling, and improved disease tracking. Virtual and augmented reality are enhancing not only patient experience but also dental professional training and planning, setting new standards for accuracy and innovation in dental care.
✅Market Restraints
Despite its many benefits, the digital dentistry market faces hurdles chiefly centered around data security and ethical considerations. The adoption of cloud-based solutions and tele-dentistry brings with it heightened risks pertaining to patient data privacy, anonymity, and informed consent, especially with networked transfers vulnerable to cyber-attacks and unauthorized access. Ethical concerns about patient data in mHealth and teledentistry represent formidable obstacles to widespread integration.
Regulatory challenges, high upfront investment costs for advanced digital technologies, and the need for ongoing professional education also slow down market expansion, particularly among smaller clinics and in developing regions. Gaining full regulatory approval for new AI-driven tools and digitized medical devices can introduce significant delays in market entry.
✅Market Opportunities
Opportunities abound for digital dentistry market players as the industry transitions towards personalized, predictive, and preventative dental care. The growth of AI-powered data analytics, cloud-based collaboration tools, and IoT-enabled devices allows dental practices to unlock actionable insights, optimize workflows, and improve patient outcomes.
Collaborations with major technology firms are enabling the creation of integrated dental ecosystems, where imaging, diagnostics, and treatment planning happen within a single, secure framework. With governments worldwide expanding their support for digital transformation in healthcare, the next decade will likely witness the rollout of more cost-effective and accessible digital dentistry solutions, particularly in emerging markets.
Global manufacturing outsourcing and the proliferation of AI and automation in countries like China and India are reducing operational costs and expanding reach. These efficiencies open doors for new entrants and established market players to capture untapped opportunities in the growing demand for advanced oral healthcare solutions.
✅Request for Customization of the Research Report: https://www.persistencemarketresearch.com/request-customization/23086
✅Reasons to Buy the Report
✔ Provides exhaustive market analysis and forecasts on the global digital dentistry sector through 2032.
✔ Delivers competitive intelligence on top technologies, growth regions, and major vendors.
✔ Unpacks key restraints such as data security, ethics, and regulatory hurdles to inform risk mitigation strategies.
✔ Highlights emerging trends in AI, IoT, and 3D printing that promise transformative shifts in dental care delivery.
✔ Offers region-by-region insights and growth strategies for players targeting North America, Europe, and fast-expanding Asian markets.
✅ Company Insights
✦ 3D Systems, Inc.
✦ Asiga
✦ BEGO GmbH & Co. KG
✦ BIOLASE, Inc.
✦ Carestream Dental LLC.
✦ Dentsply Sirona
✦ Formlabs, Inc.
✦ imes-icore GmbH
✦ Institut Straumann AG
✦ Planmeca Oy
✦ Roland DG Corporation
✦ SprintRay, Inc.
✦ Stratasys Ltd.
✦ VITA North America
✦ Zimmer Biomet Holdings, Inc.
✅ Recent market developments include:
In February 2022, Dentsply Sirona collaborated with Google Cloud to launch new medical-grade 3D printing solutions, streamlining digital workflows for clinical practices, laboratories, and end-users.
In June 2022, Formlabs established the Dental Academy, providing comprehensive training in professional dental 3D printing and digital manufacturing for practitioners and lab technicians.
✅ Conclusion
Digital dentistry stands at the forefront of the modern dental revolution, integrating data science, virtual simulation, precision manufacturing, and AI into traditional oral care. With a robust CAGR and a tripling of market value forecasted between 2023 and 2032, the sector is poised for explosive, sustained growth. Persistence Market Research emphasizes that embracing a digital-first future is not only inevitable for dental care providers but also a critical path toward maximizing patient outcomes and addressing unprecedented demand for high-quality, accessible oral healthcare solutions globally.

author: Canadian Press
title: AJHL cancels all games between five BCHL-bound teams and 11 remaining clubs
text: The Alberta Junior Hockey League has cancelled all upcoming games involving five teams poised to bolt to a rival junior A circuit and its 11 remaining clubs. The B.C. Hockey League announced Saturday the Blackfalds Bulldogs, Brooks Bandits, Okotoks Oilers, Sherwood Park Crusaders and Spruce Grove Saints will come under its umbrella in 2024-25. The AJHL scratched four games off its schedule earlier this week before Thursday's announcement. The league said in a statement it is "taking steps to protect the integrity of the AJHL and (Canadian Junior Hockey League) playoff system" along with ensuring "the safety of our players and officials." The five teams heading to the BCHL will still be allowed to play scheduled games against one another "out of respect for the players," the AJHL said. The BCHL cut ties with Hockey Canada — the sport's national governing body — in May. The league said at the time the move toward an independent setup would provide more options for players looking to compete in U.S. college hockey. The CJHL is a step below the top-tier Canadian Hockey League, which includes the Western Hockey League, Ontario Hockey League and Quebec Maritimes Junior Hockey League. This report by The Canadian Press was first published Jan. 25, 2024. The Canadian Press

author: Anonym
title: No all-clear in flood areas - rain expected - The Limited Times
text:
Status: 29.12.2023, 04:42 a.m.
CommentsPrint Share
The Pretziener Weir was last opened in June 2013. Even now, it is intended to ensure that a third of the Elbe water flows into a 21-kilometre-long canal. © Simon Kremer/dpa
Even today, the flood situation in parts of Germany is likely to remain tense. A key question is how much rain falls.
Dresden/Hanover - The situation in the flood areas remains threatening. The German Weather Service (DWD) predicted some heavy rainfall. In the reservoirs of the Bergisches Land and the Siegerland in North Rhine-Westphalia as well as the Harz Mountains, continuous rain is to be expected from Friday morning until Saturday night. Up to 40 liters per square meter could fall within 24 hours. The situation in Lower Saxony is tense. In eastern Germany, too, many fire brigades are still in continuous operation.
In Lower Saxony, areas along the rivers Aller, Leine and Weser in the southern and central parts of the state are affected. The situation there worsened further on Thursday. The dikes were no longer able to withstand the masses of water everywhere. Thousands of relief workers are deployed across the country. Evacuations were prepared in some places. In the municipality of Langlingen in the district of Celle, about 120 people left their houses and apartments during the night as a precaution. In the morning, the state government wants to give an update on the flood situation at a press conference.
Because: "Experts have been warning for a long time" Prime Minister Stephan Weil (SPD) said on Thursday that there had never been a flood of this magnitude before. "Experts have long warned that the increasing frequency of weather extremes is linked to climate change," he said. According to the Ministry of the Interior, a so-called extraordinary event was detected in six districts as well as the city of Oldenburg. With this measure, for example, counties can more easily access auxiliary staff.
The city of Verden an der Aller is also affected by the floods. © Jörn Hüneke/XOYO Film/dpa
There is also no all-clear yet around Bremen. According to the authorities on Thursday evening, numerous houses along the Wümme in the Katrepel area are surrounded by water and without electricity. Most of the residents have left this area. In the district of Timmersloh, the water is standing on the dikes. Roads and fields are flooded. According to the information provided by the Interior Ministry, measures to secure the dike have already had to be carried out several times.
No all-clear yet on the Elbe On the Elbe in Dresden, rising water levels are expected. Early Thursday afternoon, 5.92 meters were measured. This was still just below the six-metre mark from which the second-highest alert level 3 would apply. The state flood control center expected this limit to be exceeded in the morning - but only very slightly with a maximum of 6.01 meters. A normal water level of 2.00 meters in the Elbe in the state capital is normal.
The hydrologists expected a decrease in the Elbe flood water from today, as a spokesman for the State Office for the Environment, Agriculture and Geology said. Only locally light rain is expected, and neither precipitation nor snowmelt in the Czech catchment area of the Elbe is expected to date.
Downstream in Magdeburg and Schönebeck in Saxony-Anhalt, the State Agency for Flood Protection and Water Management opened the Pretzien weir on Thursday. This means that about a third of the Elbe's water is channelled past the two cities through a flood channel and across meadows and fields before flowing back into the Elbe.

Polar vortex event imminent: Climate phenomenon expected to cause the onset of winter soonread

Remedies for colds: get rid of colds and sore throats quicklyread
The flood from the German-Polish border river Oder has already partially flooded meadows in front of the dike. © Patrick Pleul/dpa
In the north of Thuringia, the focus is on the Kelbra dam, from which water has been drained. In the village of Mönchpfiffel-Nikolausrieth, there was therefore a threat that about 30 houses would be flooded, as a spokesman for the Ministry of the Interior announced on Thursday. Emergency services had set up 6000,<> sandbags on the riverbank to prevent this. According to the information, the water was about ten centimeters below the edge of the bank. Dpa

author: Mallory Mattingly
title: Notre Dame Cornerback Aspira a 'Darle Toda la Gloria a Dios' en el Campeonato CFP
text:
Foto de Alex Mertz vía Unsplash El cornerback de Notre Dame busca ‘Dar toda la gloria a Dios’ en el Campeonato CFP Por el Colaborador de Movieguide® Los Notre Dame Fighting Irish y los Ohio State Buckeyes se enfrentarán en el juego del Campeonato Nacional de Fútbol Americano Universitario el lunes 20 de enero a las 7:30 p.m. ET.
El cornerback de Notre Dame, Christian Gray, no puede esperar para el gran juego.
“Un verdadero estudiante de segundo año de St. Louis, Gray está empatado en el segundo lugar de los Fighting Irish con tres intercepciones (una de las cuales devolvió 99 yardas para un touchdown contra USC)”, informó Sports Spectrum. “También ha acumulado 32 tacleadas combinadas y un balón suelto forzado en la temporada. Gracias en parte a su producción, la defensa de Notre Dame ocupa el puesto No. 9 en el país en yardas totales permitidas por juego (298.3), No. 2 en yardas de pase permitidas (165.3), y No. 2 en puntos permitidos (14.3). ¿El equipo que es No. 1 en todas esas categorías? Los Buckeyes, el oponente de Notre Dame en el juego por el título nacional.”
Para más historias inspiradoras de deportes, visita Sports Spectrum .
Pero Gray no está enfocado en sus estadísticas. En cambio, está decidido a glorificar a Dios.
“Creo en el camino que Dios nos dio y creo en el camino en el que estamos”, dijo Gray en una entrevista con Access the Walk sobre el propósito de Dios para su equipo esta temporada.
LEER MÁS: EL QB DE NOTRE DAME ALABA A DIOS POR LA VICTORIA EN EL SUGAR BOWL, UN ‘SUEÑO HECHO REALIDAD’
“Somos humanos, y a veces pecamos. Y solo confiésale a Él… Tienes que estudiar [la Biblia], tienes que leer, tienes que hacer todo bien en el nombre del Señor para que puedas vivir por Él y ser un puente para que otros se acerquen a Él”, agregó.
Gray también reflexionó sobre el momento en que entregó su vida a Jesús.
“Solo escucho en mi corazón y en mi mente, como, ‘Este eres tú. Da gloria a Dios. Da gloria a Dios.’ Todo lo que escucho es eso”, <a href="https://www.instagram.com/p/DEihCNr

organizations.name: Colaborador de Movieguide® Los Notre Dame Fighting Irish
Campeonato Nacional de Fútbol Americano Universitario

author: Jessica Guzmán
title: Los diputados no deben ser una carga para el presidente, dice consejero político de NI
text: “Me dolería que la gente por el presidente siguiera votando por una Asamblea Legislativa nuestra, pero me dolería lo hicieran con pesar, no tenemos que ser una carga para el presidente, en una reunión que tuvimos hagamos que la Asamblea se gane no a pesar de, sino gracias a, el trabajo de nosotros no tiene que representarle una carga al presidente”, señaló Aquino en la entrevista Las Cosas Como Son. Los señalamientos de Aquino tienen a la base la polémica que se desató entre junio y agosto por las asignaciones presupuestarias que les otorgan a los diputados y las planillas que algunos divulgaron en las que aparecían las contrataciones de asesores, fotógrafos, encargado de comunicaciones, asistentes, generador de contenido, entre otros. Como ejemplo, puso el caso del diputado cian William Soriano. “Yo vi a diputados y te voy a hablar del caso de William y como digo tenemos más afinidad con unos que con otros y William de verdad estaba muy consternado y cuando hablamos por teléfono me decía yo no quiero que la gente piense que le hemos fallado al pueblo y al presidente, de verdad me dolería demasiado que esa fuera la conclusión y William salió, dio la cara, no sé si puso un sello, no sé si quitó una cosa y para colmo había sido el que había salido más castigado según una medición de disruptiva”, ejemplificó Aquino. La medición a la que se refiere Aquino es de Disruptiva, denominada El precio del Silencio en la Asamblea Legislativa, en la que expone que los diputados recibieron muchas críticas de la población que les exigía por redes sociales “rendición de cuentas y transparencia”. Pero Aquino utiliza este ejemplo para asegurar que dentro del partido “no existe ningún interés de asolapar, pero no solamente eso, sino quien va buscando eso aquí adentro poco a poco se va haciendo a un lado, porque la gente tiene filtros bien importantes”. Luego señala que la afinidad que la gente tiene por el presidente Nayib Bukele es tal, que considera que “la gente por el presidente podría fácilmente votando por una Asamblea Legislativa nuestra, pero me dolería que lo hicieran con pesar, que lo hicieran porque es el presidente quien lo pide”. Ante ese planteamiento, les reitera no solo a los diputaos cian, sino a los alcaldes que todos deben trabajar para no ser carga para el presidente. “No, nosotros como partido tenemos que hacer nuestra parte, no tenemos que ser una carga para el presidente. Yo les decía en una reunión que tuvimos: hagamos que la Asamblea se gane no a pesar de, sino gracias a. El trabajo de nosotros no tiene que representarle una carga al presidente, es injusto, ya tiene demasiada carga, igual con las alcaldías, él (Bukele) lo hizo bien, dijo yo no me vinculé a ningún alcalde, que hagan su trabajo”, mencionó Aquino.

author: Seleções
title: Ana Maria Braga revela segredo para regular o intestino; descubra qual
text: Sabemos que manter o intestino regulado é imprescindível para a saúde e o bem-estar , especialmente aquelas pessoas que tem um histórico de prisão de ventre e problemas intestinais . A apresentadora Ana Maria Braga surpreendeu ao revelar o seu segredo para manter o seu intestino funcionando de forma regular e você não vai acreditar no quão fácil é! Leia também: Saiba o que causa diarreia e como prevenir Ana Maria, que atualmente tem 74 anos e é famosa por seus programas culinários, revelou o seu segredo simples e que pode auxiliar você a controlar o seu intestino também, e isso sem muitas dificuldades ou gastos. Quer saber o segredo da celebridade? Fica com a gente. Conheça o segredo de Ana Maria Braga para regular o intestino Em entrevista ao programa "Globo Rural", a estrela da TV Globo revelou qual é a sua fórmula para manter o seu intestino funcionando bem e chocou a internet pela simplicidade: a apresentadora console sementes de mamão! Além disso, "Namaria", como é chamada na internet, pontou a importância de manter uma dieta rica em fibras e alimentos que ajudem no processo. Na produção, a apresentadora pontuou:“Eu adoro comer mamão todos os dias, mamão com semente e tudo. Me faz bem, sem ela (a semente) não vou ao banheiro, é simples”. Mas será que esse hábito da apresentadora realmente faz sentido e faz bem para a saúde? Vamos te ajudar a descobrir. Consumir sementes de mamão faz bem para a saúde? Em entrevista ao portal Terra, o nutricionista Felipe França pontua que as sementes da fruta são uma excelente fonte de fibras e nutrientes essenciais para o bom funcionamento do intestino. Para a publicação , o especialista explica: “Podemos dizer que o magnésio ajuda a amolecer as fezes e o ferro ajuda a produzir hemoglobina, que transporta oxigênio para o intestino, que é altamente necessário para o bom funcionamento intestinal. A vitamina B6 ajuda a regular a função muscular, incluindo os músculos do intestino". Entenda mais sobre o consumo de sementes de mamão e como elas podem ajudar você a regular o seu intestino assistindo ao conteúdo produzido por Angela Xavier: Gostou desse conteúdo? Confira também: Entenda como funciona a sua digestão Aproveite e acompanhe a Seleções nas redes sociais! Curta nossa página no

author: VNExplorer
title: Storm Gerrit to bring more misery after mini-tornado strikes homes
text:
The weather is expected to remain misrerable throughout the week (Picture: PA)
The last few days of 2023 are set to be blighted by strong winds, rain and snow as the UK feels the aftermath of Storm Gerrit.
Although the peak of Storm Gerrit has now passed, Thursday will continue to be blustery with showers, some heavy and more organised in parts. Friday continues this general theme with some central locations likely to see the brightest conditions.
The move comes after a supercell thunderstorm crossed Greater Manchester on Wednesday night that had a ‘strong rotating updraft’, which resulted in a ‘localised tornado’.
Around 100 properties were damaged by the ‘tornado’ in Stalybridge, Tameside, and residents in the badly hit village of Carrbrook told of the states of ‘absolute disaster’ houses were in.
However, the Met Office reported the ‘worst’ of Storm Gerrit has cleared away as of Thursday afternoon.
Meteorologist Alex Burkill said the blustery and showery picture is expected to continue overnight and into Friday, with winds expected to ease slightly across most of the UK.
A further bout of ‘very strong winds’ and a spell of ‘intense rain’ is expected on Saturday before more unsettled weather with ‘blustery, showery conditions likely as we go through New Year’s Eve’, the meteorologist added.
Met Office Chief Forecaster Steven Ramsdale said: ‘Heavy rain will spread across all but the far north on Saturday affecting similar areas previously affected by Storm Gerrit.’
Looking further ahead into 2024, there is low forecast confidence. ‘Through to mid-January, there is a signal for a shift in the pattern compared to the winter so far, with more settled and colder-than-average conditions becoming increasingly likely,’ said a Met Office spokesperson.
